ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] The Group from Hell
ygData.msgSnippet: yikes!  sure hope you put all those casters on your /ignore /scowl lists. What a bunch of jerks, like you are going to be able to get your corpses from
ygData.messageBody:
yikes! sure hope you put all those casters on your /ignore /scowl lists.
What a bunch of jerks, like you are going to be able to get your corpses
from Dalnir's where you have to run thru 2nd level to tp out without a bunch
of deaths.

course I did have a painful, if funny experience last night. Had gotten
killed in Crushbone with my rogue and was running back to my corpse. I'm
about 5 seconds from it when I get the group tell. "Okay time to run,
everybody zone!"
I look around and don't see anyone around my corpse so figure they are
behind me already. I head for the corpse only to have my group come around
the castle and run over me with their train including Dvinn. At least I
think it was Dvinn, didn't live long enough to be sure.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@...]
Sent: Wednesday, July 19, 2000 9:33 AM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] The Group from Hell



--- "Cranfill, Wendy" <Wendy_Cranfill@...>
wrote:
> But i guess after reading
> the "bad mage" thread, just wanted to point out that
> its never a bad class,
> its almost always bad players.

Sooo True.

Last week I joined a pickup group in Dalnirs. We did
pretty well in the Temple room so somebody suggested
we go down to lvl 2. As we all landed in the pool of
water, sombody got excited and pulled a nice train
into the room before we got set up. THings got bad
and somebody said gate -- The monk and I were left to
die. Funny thing, all four casters in the group had
to log at that point ...
7 deaths (6 during corpse recovery) at lvl 30 sure can
ruin your night. sigh
